> Just wanted to say we had our first success last night with the cloudsim.

That's great to hear! :confetti_ball: Thanks for all the feedback, that helps a lot.

> it is much easier for OSRF to share the details with us instead of us trying to reverse engineer / guesstimate them (both for replicating cloudsim setup locally and on AWS outside the cloudsim)

The recommendation is that teams use CloudSim for development as much as possible, your hours have just been increased. Unfortunately, providing support for various different configurations (individual local setups, AWS without CloudSim) is not feasible at the moment.

> Public IP for the field did not show up.

We're aware of this issue and working on it, thanks for the report

Just wanted to say we had our first success last night with the cloudsim.

That's great to hear! Thanks for all the feedback, that helps a lot.

it is much easier for OSRF to share the details with us instead of us trying to reverse engineer / guesstimate them (both for replicating cloudsim setup locally and on AWS outside the cloudsim)

The recommendation is that teams use CloudSim for development as much as possible, your hours have just been increased. Unfortunately, providing support for various different configurations (individual local setups, AWS without CloudSim) is not feasible at the moment.

Public IP for the field did not show up.

We're aware of this issue and working on it, thanks for the report
